name: Khalidiya Palace Rayhaan by Rotana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel and facilities: Really beautiful hotel. Fantastic sports centre with huge outdoor pool, separate male / female sauna & steam etc; and private beach (but the peace is ruined by the 3-6 jet skis permanently on the go).
reviews.title: 5 star facilities - 3 star service / food

reviews.text: Room: standard room was really big, very comfortable, gorgeous marble bathroom with separate shower and bath. There is free internet on the room's telly but its not free to use your own laptop - I thought free wi-fi was standard these days.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Restaurants: there are two main restaurants, one lobby coffee / sandwich bar, and one pool cafe. The food is the main restaurant is buffet style, but it was not good. Hot food is luke warn, cheap / chewy meat. Excellent choice and variety however.
reviews.title: amazing hotel

reviews.text: Service: very mixed. In fairness, most of the staff were lovely and very helpful. However, each morning breakfast was a struggle, and you have to fight to get coffee, salt or pepper, orange juice etc. It all makes breakfast quite unpleasant. On one morning we were told it was too busy to give us saucers with our cups!! Also, when we was checking out, there was a small dispute over the bill which should have been easily resolved, but instead a person who called himself the duty manager was rude and childish, which spoiled our stay somewhat. Also, at breakfast one morning, I was told off by one waiter by asking another for salt and he then sulked!! Good service, let alone 5 star service, is not uniform at this hotel, which is shame, as it is a lovely hotel and the majority of the staff and fantastic.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: slightly out of the centre, which is a good thing in Abu Dhabi, and taxis and really cheap anyway.
reviews.title: One of two best hotels till now

reviews.text: The Curate's egg may be a good description. Spectacular lobby and atrium spoiled by disappointing bedrooms which are more like a cheap holiday resort. Bedrooms have no carpets (just tiled floors) which make them seem outdated, cheap and nasty. Rooms have small kitchen and a fridge which whirrs all night. TV system also whirrs loudly Staff seem totally incapable of getting anything right. Restaurants are a rip off.
reviews.title: Not exactly a Palace

reviews.text: Out of the way location and on a building site
reviews.title: We are definitively staying here again in future!

aka: Khalidiya Palace Rayhaan By Rotana Hotel
description: Cast away in the turquoise waters of the Arabian Gulf Sea, Khalidiya Palace Rayhaan is the first property in the UAE under the new Brand mark Rayhaan Hotels & Resorts by Rotana, offering 443 splendid rooms and serviced apartments with their modern design complementing the values of the contemporary Arabian culture, in an alcoholic free environment. Situated in the prime area of Abu Dhabi over looking the beautiful shores of the Arabian Gulf, this fabulous city resort is only a 30 minutes drive from the Abu Dhabi International Airport and a few minutes away from various choices of the largest malls in the capital and point of cultural interest.
